page.title: 15SCHOOL LIFE AT SYTCHAMPTON
page.content: The children usually go on school trips in the summer. Parents come in to teach games: football in the winter, cricket and tennis in the summer. The school also has many fund-raising events such as car-boot sales, jumble sales, summer fetes and coffee mornings. The parent teachers Association helps with these events. At Christmas the children put on a concert for people to come and watch. Many old ladies come to watch but they also have a long chat about what they did when they were at school. The children start school at four and a half years of age and they leave school when they are nine. The lessons begin at 9.20 and they finish at 3.00pm. They have lunch at twelve.
